Love - gameplay, lore, original characters (and character design), the ability to unlock characters through in-game currency

Hate - commonly toxic community, ample bugs

The Devs do not seem to care much about making changes for killers, unless it benefits the survivors. Being a killer main this is very frustrating, however still my favorite game to date. You will love to hate it.

プレイ時間としては約２７００時間プレイしてるサバイバー７割、キラー３割の者です。
正直に言うと今現在のDead by Dayrightの状況を見てお勧めできるゲームとは言えません。
あまり説明は得意ではないので納得いく人も居れば居ない人も居ると思います。個人的にはマッチングの状況、プレイしている人のマナーの悪さ、チャットでの誹謗中傷(暴言等)、アップデートの内容が適していない。と言った意見です。本来マッチングは同じランク帯同士で行われていた(１年半前)が現在は低ランクのキラーに対して高ランクのサバイバーが多数当たってしまうマッチングの状況、それによって低ランクキラーへの高ランクサバイバーの煽りプレイが非常にこのゲームでは目立ちます。低ランクでまだ不慣れの状態のキラーやレベルを上げて多少使える様になってきたキラーなどに対してガバガバなマッチングによって当たった高ランクサバイバーの煽り(屈伸煽り、ライトに寄る挑発行為)。様に現実世界で表せば虐め見たいなものです。サバイバーをプレイしている時には、無理救助(キラーが近くに居るのに行う危険な救助)や進路妨害(チェイス中に狭い道などで道を塞ぐ行為)をしてサバイバー同士の嫌がらせ。キラーをプレイしている時には、高ランク帯のサバイバーのｐｔによる煽り行為、ゲームが終わった後にはチャットで「EZ」「雑魚」「キラー辞めたら？ｗ」など言った暴言が多々あります。これは韓国の人が多いですが日本人でも多々見かけます。アップデートに関しては個人の意見ですがサバイバーに有利になる様な修正、キラーのナーフが多いと思います。この様な個人的な意見ではありますが色々あるのでこのゲームを今から始めようかなと思っている人には申し訳ありませんがお勧めをしようとは思いません。

Вместо того, чтобы повесить меня на крюк и завершить матч - человек играющий за Чуму блевал на меня больше 10 минут, пока я не умер от кровотечения и игра не закончилась сама по себе.  10 из 10 довольных сущностей

Alright, as of this review I've logged a little over 500 hours into DBD. To say I hate to love this game is an understatement - it has some serious issues, but the overall gameplay is fun as heck. Is it more fun with friends? Absolutely. Do you want to rely on randoms? No, but that's part of the fun. I've played survivor and killer at this point (toxic survivor main, I'm so sorry) and they both have their ups and downs. 

One of the biggest problems overall is the bugs. You'll have great games, no issues, and then you'll fall into an abyss that even a camping Insidious Bubba can't pull you out of. You'll have games that end with you on a hook but somehow still on the ground moaning your life away. Hitboxes aren't actually a thing, either. Did you actually vault that pallet? No, no you didn't - you just crouched under it and still managed to get downed. I will say in the past few months since I started playing the devs have...tried. They clearly are trying to make changes and seem to be somewhat listening to their community. (Probably a big issue is the concept of a 4 v 1 ever being fair to the 1.)

It's a repetitive game at the end of the day - your goal as a survivor is to do gens and get out, and as killer goal is "frick your gens," and to smack people. There's a bunch in between, but that's really the gist of it. I'm a bit competitive so just learning how to loop/run around is fun for me, but if you're not into repetitive gameplay it  might not be the best choice. 

Overall, I'm going to keep on hitting those skill checks and being jump-scared by a crouching Pig. It's worth trying out, but beware the addiction possibility and just the overall bugginess. Sorry @ my other games, I gotta get out with my flashlight! 11/10, I need my life back @ DBD.
its way to easy as a monster. plane and simple the only way to win as a surviver is to either wait till all teamates die then find the exit hatch, or go against someone who is new to the game.

After 450 hours in this game i can say that i am done with it. First of all most of the community is very toxic i play killer and i can say that almost everybody will be mean with you during the game. And do not forget the mmr wich is so so bad. In a match i play with survivors who dont know how to play because they just got into it and in next one i play with survivors that have 2000 hours that will literally destroy you, make the game unfun and piss you off every time witch is the reason i uninstalled the game. I just cant have fun anymore. I hope Behaviour will do something about this mmr so i and many others can have fun again. Until then i will never open this game again
This game has it's flaws (Balance, bugs, Dedicated servers) however is very very fun to play and can get you hooked (pun intended) for hours at a time.
